Surprisingly, those rumors turned out to be false. The 2026 Jeep Recon is alive and well, and will go into production in early 2026, with initial launches planned for the US and Canada. Jeep says the Recon will churn out 650 horsepower, 620lb-ft of torque, and a modest range of 250 miles. But will anyone shell out for an electric Wrangler facsimile that costs over double the price of a normal Wrangler? When it does go on sale, the Recon will likely confront a lot of the same headwinds as the Wagoneer S, and frankly the rest of Jeep‚Äôs lineup, which has been struggling to find buyers in recent years amid soaring costs and over-reliance on big, expensive SUVs. Past deal history gives us a few clues about what to expect. Apple Watches: Apple‚Äôs latest-gen Apple Watches often hit their best prices to date during Black Friday. Last year, for instance, the Series 10 dropped to $329, while the second-gen SE fell to a mere $149 in its entry-level configuration. Current-gen models ‚Äî including the AirPods 4 ‚Äî could dip again, too, especially given they recently hit a new low of $84.99 ($45 off) before climbing back up. iPads and MacBooks: New iPad models, including the new M5 iPad Pro, may dip a little further in price next week, especially since they‚Äôve recently been hovering just above their lowest prices to date. Previous sales indicate the current-gen base iPad could drop to as low as $279 on Black Friday, which would match its best price to date.
